pullRequest.body:
Define `toNNRealLinear` that maps positive `Real`-linear functionals to `NNReal`-linear functionals and prove that it is injective.

---
- [x] depends on: #21205 for `comp_left`

Motivation: I use this to define `rieszMeasure` for `Real`-linear functional in #12290.

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```

```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
lemma coe_toReal (f : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)) :
    toReal f = (f : C_c(Î±, â„)) := rfl
```
This strikes me as a perhaps surprising coercion. Could you at least write it using `ContinuousLinearMap.comp`?
Could you elaborate why this is surprising? I thought it were natural because there is a coercion `(X â†’ â„â‰¥0) â†’ (X â†’ â„)`. Yet most probably this should be in another file

> there is a coercion `(X â†’ â„â‰¥0) â†’ (X â†’ â„)`

Wait, where did you get that from? The following doesn't work:
```
import Mathlib

open scoped NNReal

example {X : Type*} (f : X â†’ â„â‰¥0) : X â†’ â„ := f
```
mmm sorry, I thought I had that coercion (and I thought I had done a test twice on Lean 4 web!) but you are right, it does not work. So should I not define the coercion?
Yes, I think that coercion is a bad idea. Better write things explicitly in terms of `ContinuousLinearMap.comp`
I see, I removed the coercions

Can you write this in terms of `CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.comp`? 
```suggestion
noncomputable def toReal (f : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)) : C_c(Î±, â„) :=
  f.comp somethingNewHere
```

I'm not sure whether I understood what you mean. `CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.comp` makes the composition `g âˆ˜ f` where `f : C_c(Î³, Î´)`, `g : Î² â†’co Î³)`. Here we have ` f : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)` and `ContinuousMap.coeNNRealReal : â„â‰¥0 â†’ â„`.

Sorry, I guess I'm not sure what the correct setup is, but you see that you're basically bundling the fact `HasCompactSupport.comp_left` into an operation on `C_c(_, _)`, right? My question is whether you can extract that out to a function that doesn't mention concrete types like `â„â‰¥0` or `â„`. Maybe something of the form `C_c(Î², Î³) â†’ (Î± â†’+ Î²) â†’ C_c(Î±, Î³)`.
ah I see. I added `comp_left`.

You tend to add extraneous brackets in your expressions. Could you please go through your PRs and make sure you don't have any such?
```suggestion
    toNNRealLinear hÎ› f = Î› (toReal f) := rfl
```
sorry. I hopefully removed all such brackets.
Any reason you're squeezing this simp? It's already terminal
left only `simp`
Same here
done
and here too hopefully you can have a single terminal simp instead of all this
here I have to `rw` first
Can you make this a separate PR?
done.

```suggestion
  f.compLeft ContinuousMap.coeNNRealReal
```

```suggestion
lemma toReal_apply (f : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0)) (x : Î±) : f.toReal x = f x := compLeft_apply rfl
```

```suggestion
  toFun f := f.compLeft ContinuousMap.coeNNRealReal
```

```suggestion
    simp [NNReal.smul_def]
```
works hopefully?

```suggestion
noncomputable def toRealLinearMap : C_c(Î±, â„â‰¥0) â†’â‚—[â„â‰¥0] C_c(Î±, â„) where
```
or something like that

```suggestion
  toFun := toReal f
  map_add' f g := by ext x; simp
  map_smul' a f := by ext x; simp [NNReal.smul_def]
```

```suggestion
  toFun f := âŸ¨Î› (LinearMap.toReal f), hÎ› (LinearMap.toReal f) <| by simpâŸ©
```

```suggestion
noncomputable def toNNRealLinear (Î› : C_c(Î±, â„) â†’â‚—[â„] â„) (hÎ› : âˆ€ f, 0 â‰¤ f â†’ 0 â‰¤ Î› f) :
```
to avoid proofs being elided in the infoview

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma toNNRealLinear_inj {Î›â‚ Î›â‚‚ : C_c(Î±, â„) â†’â‚—[â„] â„} (hÎ›â‚ hÎ›â‚‚) :
    toNNRealLinear Î›â‚ hÎ›â‚ = toNNRealLinear Î›â‚‚ hÎ›â‚‚ â†” Î›â‚ = Î›â‚‚ := by
```

```suggestion
  toFun := toReal
```
whoops

source.title: feat(MeasureTheory/Integral): the Riesz-Markov-Kakutani theorem for `Real`-linear functionals
